snippet: Women can find themselves caught in a double standard at work, needing to promote themselves and yet not appear too pushy.
abstract: The Upshot; gender discrimination trial involving venture capital firm Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers and accusations by former junior partner Ellen Pao offers illustration of how gender discrimination is now more manifest in subtle slights and double standards; while overt sexual harassment is less common than in the past, suit shows that one key area of discrimination lies in self-promotion, where women are faulted for traits that are often praised in men.
lead_paragraph: Women can find themselves caught in a double standard at work, needing to promote themselves and yet not appear too pushy.

headline.print_headline: In Silicon Valley Suit, More Subtle Questions About Sex Bias
headline.main: A Racy Silicon Valley Lawsuit, and More Subtle Questions About Sex Discrimination
